subject: Apply ceph_conf_overrides for non-deployed_ceph services
commit_message:
Apply ceph_conf_overrides for non-deployed_ceph services

When deployed_ceph is not used, all ceph_conf_overrides in
cephadm-extra-vars-heat.yml are applied during the bootstrap
process via cephadm's config assimilation. This might include
overrides needed by services like RGW which is out of scope of
deployed_ceph. When deployed_ceph is used, these configurations
were not getting applied as they missed their chance during
bootstrap which casued bug 1946253. Thus, add a new task to
assimilate configuration not just during bootstrap but any
time the tripleo_cephadm role is run.

Rename tripleo_cephadm_{bootstrap,assimilation}_conf as
it's used in assimilatiaon not just during bootstrap but
also when new configurations are added (e.g. adding RGW
to a deployed ceph cluster).

Closes-Bug: #1946253

subject: Fix DHCP acls for ML2/OVN backend
commit_message:
Fix DHCP acls for ML2/OVN backend

Probably during switch to port groups usage of the add_acl_dhcp function
was somehow dropped and due to that dhcp requests which were comming out
from the VM were blocked if there was no any other SG rule which would
allow that traffic.
Usually it isn't problem as by default SG has rules to allow all egress
traffic but if such rules would be deleted from SG, then VM can't get IP
address from the DHCP anymore.

It's now fixed in the similar way like it is done for e.g. iptables or
openvswitch firewall driver in ML2/OVS case. Extra port group with ACL
to allow such DHCP requests is created, it's very similar to
neutron_pg_drop port group. Next, each port is added to that specific
port group to have allowed egress DHCP requests.

Closes-Bug: #1926515
Change-Id: I9fe7be517abbaf50b55192e72673d7480e05ba77

subject: Do less locking on l3 agent greenpool resize
commit_message:
Do less locking on l3 agent greenpool resize

currently each pool resize attempt tries to grab a syncronized lock,
even if it will actually do not resize the pool in the end.

Due to this, when max pool size is reached, agent may spawn many
greenthreads that all at once are trying to grab the lock, hogging
resources, which is particularly noticible on full sync of large enough
number of routers.

This patch does attempt to grab the lock only if the pool is actually
going to be resized.

subject: Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts
commit_message:
Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the timeout
given to the managed podman action + 1 sec. Then if it expires, kill
its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group) before rerunning the
same operation. Also note that using KilMode process is not recommended
by systemd man pages.

Change-Id: I6d0309e5e38a1b1d0b29768ab86592be26d09629

commit_message:

Currently the API code for parsing 'tags' filter value assumes a format
of comma-delimited string with no spaces, example:

but python-openstackclient and python-novaclient both pass the filter

subject: Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects
commit_message:
Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects

The backdoor command fo() uses isinstance() to check if an object is an
instance of a class. This only works with objects that have a __class__
attribute, else an AttributeError is raised by isinstance(). This is
seldomly the case, though if there is one such object fo() will cease to
work. Therefore we need to protect us against this case by checking for
a __class__ attribute before calling isinstance().

An example for an object without __class__ would be
functools._lru_list_elem.

subject: Transition Keystone admin user to system scope
commit_message:
Transition Keystone admin user to system scope

A system-scoped token implies the user has authorization to act on the
deployment system. These tokens are useful for interacting with
resources that affect the deployment as a whole, or exposes resources
that may otherwise violate project or domain isolation.

Since Queens, the keystone-manage bootstrap command assigns the admin
role to the admin user with system scope, as well as in the admin
project. This patch transitions the Keystone admin user from
authenticating using project scoped tokens to system scoped tokens.
This is a necessary step towards being able to enable the updated oslo
policies in services that allow finer grained access to system-level
resources and APIs.

An etherpad with discussion about the transition to the new oslo
service policies is:

subject: WIP: Reconstructor: Use past node and abort to handoff
commit_message:
WIP: Reconstructor: Use past node and abort to handoff

Before the reconstructor makes a bunch of connections to go rebuild
the missing fragment it makes it takes advantage of the last_primary
table in the ring. If there is a last primariy for the missing frags
partition then it'll first do a HEAD to see if the missing fragment
for the same timestamp exists there. If it does, it will tell the
current ssync session to abort and skip this datafile, and let the
handoff REVERT the missing fragment saving a needless rebuild.

In order to abort the current diskfile in ssync, a new ssync exception
has been created called SsyndAbortDataFile which can be thrown from the
sync_diskfile_builder callback. When thrown the ssync sender will move
onto the next diskfile to send.

Finally it's also triggering a statsd found.last_node metric because it

subject: compute: Fix filtering servers by tags
commit_message:
compute: Fix filtering servers by tags

The nova API expects the 'tags' and 'not-tags' filters of the 'GET
/servers' (list servers) API to be a CSV string [1]:

  tags (Optional)
    A list of tags to filter the server list by. Servers that match all
    tags in this list will be returned. Boolean expression in this case
    is 't1 AND t2'. Tags in query must be separated by comma.

    New in version 2.26

  not-tags (Optional)
    A list of tags to filter the server list by. Servers that don’t
    match all tags in this list will be returned. Boolean expression in
    this case is 'NOT (t1 AND t2)'. Tags in query must be separated by
    comma.

    New in version 2.26

We were instead providing a Python list, which was simply being URL
encoded. Correct this.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-servers-detail#list-servers

subject: Modernize rabbitmq's TLS support
commit_message:
Modernize rabbitmq's TLS support

The depend-on change switches rabbit's nodename to FQDN and adds
the CA in the config. This puppet change does the following:
1. Switches the default tls versions to 1.2 and 1.3
2. Drops the old hard-coded cipher list that used to be needed to avoid
   falling back to tls 1.0
3. Introduce a verify_peer_{client,server} parameter. The former is set
   to verify_peer by default, so that rabbitmq 3.9 does not emit
   warnings (see original LP description)
4. Splits off all erlang ssl parameters to a separate file called
   /etc/rabbitmq/ssl-dist.conf. Reason for this is that it is cleaner
   and not all configurable items are supported by erlang as command
   line arguments. (In particular the ssl versions)
5. Make sure we pass the custom CA inside the HA bundle (this had to
   be split out to Ib0236f9c086d520d0a27e3aa8b41927bc7b50c26
   (Bind mount the IPA crt when internal_tls is enabled) for CI to pass
   on all reviews.

Tested as follows:
A. Deployed and run tempest against a TLS-E overcloud that uses as
   rabbitmq 3.9 + erlang 24.1 stack
B. Made sure that only tls1.2 and/or tls1.3 are allowed on port 5672
   and 25672

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_1 |grep ^New
00CCA0CAB37F0000:error:0A00042E:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:tlsv1 alert protocol version:ssl/record/rec_layer_s3.c:1584:SSL alert number 70
New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_2 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.2, Cipher is ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_3 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

>>> from oslo_config import cfg

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>

ValueError: 1 is not a valid host address

calling super in it's __init__() method, which resulted in the type_name not

subject: s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts
commit_message:
s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts

Previously, when a user requested limited part listings, two bad things
could happen:

 * For the initial request, the proxy wouldn't have the full list of
   parts to sort, causing us to omit some uploaded parts (often, parts
   2-9).

 * For the subsequent request with a part-number-marker param, we
   wouldn't include any sort of marker in the request to the container
   server, causing us to get *the same set of parts*, all of which would
   be filtered out in the proxy.

This is because we don't zero-pad part numbers in the +segments

subject: Modernize rabbitmq's TLS support
commit_message:
Modernize rabbitmq's TLS support

The depend-on change switches rabbit's nodename to FQDN and adds
the CA in the config. This puppet change does the following:
1. Switches the default tls versions to 1.2 and 1.3
2. Drops the old hard-coded cipher list that used to be needed to avoid
   falling back to tls 1.0
3. Introduce a verify_peer_{client,server} parameter. The former is set
   to verify_peer by default, so that rabbitmq 3.9 does not emit
   warnings (see original LP description)
4. Splits off all erlang ssl parameters to a separate file called
   /etc/rabbitmq/ssl-dist.conf. Reason for this is that it is cleaner
   and not all configurable items are supported by erlang as command
   line arguments. (In particular the ssl versions)
5. Make sure we pass the custom CA inside the HA bundle (this had to
   be split out to Ib0236f9c086d520d0a27e3aa8b41927bc7b50c26
   (Bind mount the IPA crt when internal_tls is enabled) for CI to pass
   on all reviews.

Tested as follows:
A. Deployed and run tempest against a TLS-E overcloud that uses as
   rabbitmq 3.9 + erlang 24.1 stack
B. Made sure that only tls1.2 and/or tls1.3 are allowed on port 5672
   and 25672

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_1 |grep ^New
00CCA0CAB37F0000:error:0A00042E:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:tlsv1 alert protocol version:ssl/record/rec_layer_s3.c:1584:SSL alert number 70
New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_2 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.2, Cipher is ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_3 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

Closes-Bug: #1946374

Don't create deployment when changing transport

Earlier when changing software config transport we used to
create a dummy deployment to push the metadata. However
this would not work with convergence as we take

transport (another engine would try to update the resource
metadata for deployment when one engine has locked it).

Currently it works when updating transport as we ignore
the error in creating dummy deployment, but if there are
any new depoyments for the server they would fail.

We don't need to push the metadata as it would be pushed
when the there is a new/updated deployment.

- We don't need to ignore the error as servers are now
not replaced if the resource is in ERROR when nova server
is good/ACTIVE.

is not able to determine the underlying type of the symlink
